intro: Brassaia acuminata, commonly known as the Cape primrose, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from pink to violet. The plant typically grows as a shrub or subshrub, reaching heights of up to 1 meter, with opposite, ovate leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. It thrives in well-drained soil and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden cultivation. Brassaia acuminata is also known for its ability to produce abundant blooms throughout the growing season.
